com.ojcoleman.ahni.transcriber
Class HyperNEATTranscriber.CPPN

java.lang.Object
  com.ojcoleman.ahni.transcriber.HyperNEATTranscriber.CPPN
Enclosing class:
HyperNEATTranscriber<T extends Activator>
protected class HyperNEATTranscriber.CPPN
extends java.lang.Object

Provides a wrapper for an Activator that represents a CPPN.

Method Detail

resetSourceCoordinates

public void resetSourceCoordinates()
Set the inputs to the CPPN for the source coordinates to 0. This is useful when querying the CPPN for a single point in the substrate rather than for a connection (which is from one point to another). The coordinates for the single point should be set via the setTargetCoordinates methods.

setSourceCoordinates

public void setSourceCoordinates(double x,
                                 double y)
Set the coordinates of the source neuron in a two-dimensional substrate with dimensions with range [0, 1] (coordinates are translated to a user-specified range if necessary, e.g. see HyperNEATTranscriber.rangeX).

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate, range should be [0, 1].
y - The y coordinate, range should be [0, 1].

setSourceCoordinates

public void setSourceCoordinates(double x,
                                 double y,
                                 double z)
Set the coordinates of the source neuron in a three-dimensional substrate with dimensions with range [0, 1] (coordinates are translated to a user-specified range if necessary, e.g. see HyperNEATTranscriber.rangeX). If the z coordinate is not required it will be ignored.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate, range should be [0, 1].
y - The y coordinate, range should be [0, 1].
z - The z coordinate, range should be [0, 1].

setSourceCoordinates

public void setSourceCoordinates(Point p)
Set the coordinates of the source neuron in a substrate with dimensions with range [0, 1] (coordinates are translated to a user-specified range if necessary, e.g. see HyperNEATTranscriber.rangeX). If the z coordinate is not required it will be ignored.

Parameters:
p - A Point containing the coordinates of the source neuron. Coordinates should be in range [0, 1].

setSourceCoordinatesFromGridIndices

public void setSourceCoordinatesFromGridIndices(int x,
                                                int y,
                                                int z)
Set the coordinates of the source neuron specified by the given indices into a grid-based substrate. If the z coordinate is not required it will be ignored. Subclasses of HyperNEATTranscriber should generally use this method instead of directly specifying coordinates as this method supports specifying arbitrary coordinates for neurons via HyperNEATTranscriber.NEURON_POSITIONS_FOR_LAYER or coordinates specified by the fitness function. Note that if custom coordinates have been specified for a layer then the values of the x and y parameters may not correlate linearly to the actual coordinates if the layer does not use a regular grid-based layout, however this detail can generally be ignored by subclasses, they can just blindly rely on the HyperNEATTranscriber.width and HyperNEATTranscriber.height values (see HyperNEATTranscriberBain for an example).

Parameters:
x - The index of the source neuron in the X dimension.
y - The index of the source neuron in the Y dimension.
z - The index of the source neuron in the Z dimension (the layer index).

setTargetCoordinates

public void setTargetCoordinates(double x,
                                 double y)
Set the coordinates of the source neuron in a two-dimensional substrate with dimensions with range [0, 1] (coordinates are translated to a user-specified range if necessary, e.g. see HyperNEATTranscriber.rangeX).

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate, range should be [0, 1].
y - The y coordinate, range should be [0, 1].

setTargetCoordinates

public void setTargetCoordinates(double x,
                                 double y,
                                 double z)
Set the coordinates of the source neuron in a three-dimensional substrate with dimensions with range [0, 1] (coordinates are translated to a user-specified range if necessary, e.g. see HyperNEATTranscriber.rangeX). If the z coordinate is not required it will be ignored.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate, range should be [0, 1].
y - The y coordinate, range should be [0, 1].
z - The z coordinate, range should be [0, 1].

setTargetCoordinates

public void setTargetCoordinates(Point p)
Set the coordinates of the target neuron in a substrate with dimensions with range [0, 1] (coordinates are translated to a user-specified range if necessary, e.g. see HyperNEATTranscriber.rangeX). If the z coordinate is not required it will be ignored.

Parameters:
p - A Point containing the coordinates of the target neuron. Coordinates should be in range [0, 1].

setTargetCoordinatesFromGridIndices

public void setTargetCoordinatesFromGridIndices(int x,
                                                int y,
                                                int z)
Set the coordinates of the target neuron specified by the given indices into a grid-based substrate. If the z coordinate is not required it will be ignored. Subclasses of HyperNEATTranscriber should generally use this method instead of directly specifying coordinates as this method supports specifying arbitrary coordinates for neurons via HyperNEATTranscriber.NEURON_POSITIONS_FOR_LAYER or coordinates specified by the fitness function. Note that if custom coordinates have been specified for a layer then the values of the x and y parameters may not correlate linearly to the actual coordinates if the layer does not use a regular grid-based layout, however this detail can generally be ignored by subclasses, they can just blindly rely on the HyperNEATTranscriber.width and HyperNEATTranscriber.height values (see HyperNEATTranscriberBain for an example).

Parameters:
x - The index of the target neuron in the X dimension.
y - The index of the target neuron in the Y dimension.
z - The index of the target neuron in the Z dimension (the layer index).

getCoordinatesForGridIndices

public Point getCoordinatesForGridIndices(int x,
                                          int y,
                                          int z,
                                          Point p)
Get the coordinates of the neuron specified by the given indices into a grid-based substrate. If the z coordinate is not required it will be ignored. If custom coordinates have been specified via HyperNEATTranscriber.NEURON_POSITIONS_FOR_LAYER or by the fitness function these will be returned for the affected neurons. Note that if custom coordinates have been specified for a layer then the values of the x and y parameters may not correlate linearly to the actual coordinates if the layer does not use a regular grid-based layout, however this detail can generally be ignored by subclasses, they can just blindly rely on the HyperNEATTranscriber.width and HyperNEATTranscriber.height values (see HyperNEATTranscriberBain for an example).

Parameters:
x - The index of the target neuron in the X dimension.
y - The index of the target neuron in the Y dimension.
z - The index of the target neuron in the Z dimension (the layer index).
p - A Point can be passed in to avoid the creation of a new Point for every call to this method. If supplied it will be returned. If null then a new Point will be returned.
Returns:
A Point with the relevant coordinates.

query

public double query()
Query this CPPN.

Returns:
The value of the (first) weight output. Other outputs can be retrieved with the various get methods.

queryWithGridIndices

public double queryWithGridIndices(int sx,
                                   int sy,
                                   int sz,
                                   int tx,
                                   int ty,
                                   int tz)
Query this CPPN with the specified grid indices, see setSourceCoordinatesFromGridIndices(int, int, int) and setTargetCoordinatesFromGridIndices(int, int, int). Subclasses of HyperNEATTranscriber should generally use this method instead of directly specifying coordinates as this method supports specifying arbitrary coordinates for neurons via HyperNEATTranscriber.NEURON_POSITIONS_FOR_LAYER.

Returns:
The value of the (first) weight output. Other outputs can be retrieved with the various get methods.

getWeight

public double getWeight()
Get the value of the weight. Should be called after calling query().

getRangedWeight

public double getRangedWeight()
Get the value of the weight. Should be called after calling query(). The output will be transformed to be within the specified range and may optionally have a threshold applied.

getWeight

public double getWeight(int index)
Get the value of a connection weight, either within a specified layer (in a layered feed-forward network encoded with HyperNEATTranscriber.HYPERNEAT_LAYER_ENCODING set to false), OR for the specified synapse type index. Should be called after calling query().

getRangedWeight

public double getRangedWeight(int index)
Get the value of a connection weight, either within a specified layer (in a layered feed-forward network encoded with HyperNEATTranscriber.HYPERNEAT_LAYER_ENCODING set to false), OR for the specified synapse type index. Should be called after calling query(). The output will be transformed to be within the specified range and may optionally have a threshold applied.

getBiasWeight

public double getBiasWeight()
Get the bias value for a neuron. Should be called after calling query(). The bias is usually queried for a target neuron after setting the source coordinate values to 0.

getRangedBiasWeight

public double getRangedBiasWeight()
Get the bias value for a neuron. Should be called after calling query(). The bias is usually queried for a target neuron after setting the source coordinate values to 0. The output will be transformed to be within the specified range and may optionally have a threshold applied.

getBiasWeight

public double getBiasWeight(int index)
Get the bias value for a neuron, either within a specified layer (in a layered feed-forward network encoded with HyperNEATTranscriber.HYPERNEAT_LAYER_ENCODING set to false), OR for the specified neuron type index. Should be called after calling query(). The bias is usually queried for a target neuron after setting the source coordinate values to 0.

getRangedBiasWeight

public double getRangedBiasWeight(int index)
Get the bias value for a neuron, either within a specified layer (in a layered feed-forward network encoded with HyperNEATTranscriber.HYPERNEAT_LAYER_ENCODING set to false), OR for the specified neuron type index. Should be called after calling query(). The bias is usually queried for a target neuron after setting the source coordinate values to 0. The output will be transformed to be within the specified range and may optionally have a threshold applied.

getLEO

public boolean getLEO()
Get the value of the link expression output (see HyperNEATTranscriber.HYPERNEAT_LEO). Should be called after calling query(). If LEO is not enabled true is returned.

getLEO

public boolean getLEO(int index)
Get the value of the link expression output (see HyperNEATTranscriber.HYPERNEAT_LEO), either within a specified layer (in a layered feed-forward network encoded with HyperNEATTranscriber.HYPERNEAT_LAYER_ENCODING set to false), OR for the specified synapse type index. Should be called after calling query(). If LEO is not enabled true is returned.

getNEO

public boolean getNEO()
Get the value of the neuron expression output (see HyperNEATTranscriber.HYPERNEAT_NEO). Should be called after calling query(). If NEO is not enabled true is returned.

getNEO

public boolean getNEO(int index)
Get the value of the neuron expression output (see HyperNEATTranscriber.HYPERNEAT_NEO), either within a specified layer (in a layered feed-forward network encoded with HyperNEATTranscriber.HYPERNEAT_LAYER_ENCODING set to false), OR for the specified neuron type index. Should be called after calling query(). If NEO is not enabled true is returned.

getNeuronParam

public double getNeuronParam(int type,
                             int paramIndex)
Get the value of a neuron model parameter output for the specified neuron type and parameter. Should be called after calling query().

getRangedNeuronParam

public double getRangedNeuronParam(int type,
                                   int paramIndex)
Get the value of a neuron model parameter output for the specified neuron type and parameter. Should be called after calling query(). The output will be transformed to be within the specified range and may optionally have a threshold applied. TODO provide setting for threshold for parameters? Currently it's set to 5% of whatever the current parameter range is.

                              int paramIndex)
Get the value of a synapse model parameter output for the specified synapse type and parameter. Should be called after calling query().

getRangedSynapseParam

                                    int paramIndex)
Get the value of a synapse model parameter output for the specified synapse type and parameter. Should be called after calling query(). The output will be transformed to be within the specified range and may optionally have a threshold applied. TODO provide setting for threshold for parameters? Currently it's set to 5% of whatever the current parameter range is.

getOutput

public double getOutput(int index)
Get the value of the output with the given index. This is useful for sub-classes of HyperNEATTranscriber that add additional outputs to the CPPN.

getRangedOutput

public double getRangedOutput(int index,
                              double minValue,
                              double maxValue,
                              double valueRange,
                              double threshold)
Get the value of the output with the given index. This is useful for sub-classes of HyperNEATTranscriber that add additional outputs to the CPPN. The output will be transformed to be within the specified range and may optionally have a threshold applied.

getNeuronTypeIndex

public int getNeuronTypeIndex()
Get the neuron type index. May be used as an index into TranscriberAdaptor.neuronModelTypes and for the type argument in methods like getNeuronParam(int, int) and getBiasWeight(int) (and the associated "Ranged" methods.

See Also:
getSelectorValue(int[])

getSynapseTypeIndex

public int getSynapseTypeIndex()
Get the synapse type index. May be used as an index into TranscriberAdaptor.synapseModelTypes and for the type argument in methods like getSynapseParam(int, int), getWeight(int) and getLEO(int) (and the associated "Ranged" methods.

See Also:
getSelectorValue(int[])

getSelectorValue

public int getSelectorValue(int[] indices)
Determine which output from the CPPN over the set of outputs specified by the given set of indices has the highest output value. If the length of the given indices array is 1 then the single specified output is treated as a binary output.

Parameters:
indices - An array containing index values into the CPPN output array.
Returns:
The index into the given indices array for the corresponding output with the highest output value, or if a single output is being treated as a binary output then 0 if the output represents 'false' and 1 if the output represents 'true'. The actual output values corresponding to 'false' and 'true' depend on the range of the output: if the minimum output value is less than 0 then an output less than or equal to 0 is interpreted as false, otherwise an output value less than half the maximum output value is interpreted as 'false'.
